title: Thunderbird ICS Import Wizard
creator: denyerec
content:
Two questions:

1- Is it possible to assign defaults for ICS import so that you don't have to go through the wizard?

The reason for this wish is question two...

2- Why does the "Next" button in the import wizard appear in a different place in each step? I have a whole bunch of separate ICS files to import due to a workflow issue, and importing them is like playing whack-a-mole. It'd be a huge improvement if the "Next" button could stay in a consistent place so that even if defaults can't be set up, you can just click-click-click in one place without having to dance around with the mouse :)
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/142.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

title: Unable to email
creator: dbdonegan
content: I cannot email, or reply. When I try a small window appears with options "File or Edit".

title: Thunderbird keeps semi freezing up
creator: brinkley_mike
content: For quite a few months now, Thunderbird has been acting weird. My emails download, I can sometimes open and delete some, but after a short time, it gets stuck on one email and won't open any more at all. I also can't open any menus, but I can change inbox folders, but still only the original email is shown. It's really hard to troubleshoot and try to fix, as I can't get to any of the menus most of the time. This happens in safe mode as well. This is getting really irritating as I've been using Thunderbird for many years, and I'd like to fix it rather than find a new email program.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/144.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;os:Windows 11

title: An error occurred while sending mail.
creator: wayne.mackinnon
content:
I have 2 parallel accounts with the same ISP. As of 2 days ago, whenever I try to send mail, I get this message: 

  “Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: Command rejected. Please verify that your email address is correct in your account settings and try again.”

I receive mail as normal. Using the other address with exactly the same settings allows me to send normally as I have for the past ten years! Nothing appears different anywhere in the settings. There were no upgrades that I am aware of. I have since found that I can send from my basic little "travel" computer without issue. Any ideas? BTW, using POP mail settings.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:109.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/115.0

title: Thunderbird email accounts
creator: sclarkharris
content:
I have two personal Thunderbird accounts that were under two other email addresses on an old computer. They are [email1] @mlecwb.net and [email2] @mlecwb.net

Can I access them another way, since that computer is not working well enough to download emails? Plus the old email addresses will be disappearing with the the company l have the email addresses under.....

Then if I can get into the old messages, can I download and save some of the messages - or at least important ones in specific group files - onto another computer or a laptop? Or even on a CD?

Also, could I still use Thunderbird under another email address?

Susan Clark Harris [email3] @outlook.com

title: Adding colours to inbox
creator: acb4102
content: Is it possible to add different background colours to the three inbox folders I have now, please? I can change the colours of mail I send (via Composition), but not mail I get. It'd make it easier to prioritise work flow. I've found an old (2020) AddColors Add-On as part of the Unified Folders page but it's no longer supported and Firefox doesn't verify it.
